chat.msg: hey!!! ya comenzamos?
first cross the stick bridge onto the island with the tiger
Muy bien, estoy parado al lado del tigre.
¿Adónde vamos ahora, amigo mío?
go around and under the rock and cross the bridge and stop just in front of the bush
está bien
Estoy en el monte ahora. ¿Cuál es la jugada aquí?
go counter clockwise around the bush with the parrot and exit at the rock bridge to the island with the frog, stopping right at the end
¡bien entendido! aquí estoy, justo al final del puente, mirando al frente
¿dónde debería ir ahora?

go diagonally to the right by about 45 degrees towards the south until you're lateral with the southern-most toe of the frog, then go parallel with the frog until you have passed it, and perform a u-turn and go past the brown trees until you get to the crocodile bridge. Cross the crocodile bridge, go straight over the black rock above it, and go over the rock bridge to the island with the giraffe. Creep along the seabed to the south until you get to the bridge that goes to the treasure island, cross it, and head straight for the treasure.
¡acción completa, amigo! encontré el tesoro
*finalizado*
hola, q tal? ready to start?
simón. Where do I go right now?
cool, just go a bit left and pass below that wooden bench
then, cross the trail and walk towards the florist stand. but hey, don't reach it! pull a quick 180 and head back to our white fluffy friend
am I going back to where I started, essentially?
¡exactamente! Después de regresar con nuestro amigo peludo blanco, pasa por la rama debajo de ti y continúa hacia el sur.
Hay otro perro blanco esperando cerca de la alfombra de picnic a cuadros. Es un poco lindo, ¿no te parece?
do I go towards that dog?
Sí, camina sobre la alfombra de picnic a cuadros, cepilla ligeramente el cuenco de bayas y luego dirígete hacia el oeste.
where do I go after the berry bowl?
Justo después de eso, verás otra rama de madera.
cruzar el río en dirección norte. cosas interesantes, ¿verdad?
sí, muy interesante. He cruzado la ramay estoy en la final. Adónde voy ya?
Now, you have a green bush in sight, but don't touch it
instead, walk around the right side until you reach the flower stand. you are excited? this is exciting!
I am at the flower stand. Where do I go now?
¡excelente! Desde aquí, gira a la izquierda, pasa por debajo del puesto de flores hacia ese gran puente con dos ciclistas.
sigue dirigiéndote hacia el oeste. ¡Lo estás haciendo genial, hombre!
Do I exit the map from there to the west?
No, no tan rápido amigo.
Después del puente, verás una encantadora pareja de ancianos leyendo el periódico. ¡Pero no los molestes!
Where do I go from there?
solo muévete unos pasos hacia el sur
Verás otra rama de madera y un arbusto verde cerca del final.
hey there, estas listo?
you are at the campsite. Go south past those rocks on the left and once you pass the dog, snake around the dog and the firepit by going around the south of the dog and the north of the firepit
Muy bien, acabo de pasar las rocas.
Ahora estoy justo al lado del perro, yendo hacia el sur y luego hacia el norte alrededor del pozo de fuego. ¿que sigue?
where are you right now?
Acabo de navegar alrededor del pozo de fuego, ahora veo un hongo rojo a la derecha
¿Adónde vamos ahora, amigo?

move to the right a little along the trail until you are lateral with the rightmost edge of the mushrooms. Then, make a u-turn towards the west and follow the trail towards the south until you get to the edge of the telescope
listo, hice un giro en u desde los hongos y seguí hacia el sur
Ahora estoy al borde del telescopio. ¿Cuál es el próximo paso, compadre?

go around the edge of the telescope then take a shortcut by cutting across the grass, going directly between the telescope on the west and the bush on the east. When you're back on the trail, turn right towards the west, then turn towards the little armpit crevice of rocks. Climb up to that crevice and then enter the house.
lo tengo, rodeé el telescopio, atravesé la hierba entre el telescopio y el arbusto
luego giré hacia el oeste, entre en el pequeño ensanchamiento formado por las rocas y subí hasta la casa. ¡listo, ya estamos aquí! *finalizado*
hey, q tal? empezamos el juego?
I'm ready. I'm by the palm trees, where do I go?
Genial, ¡hagamos esto! comience dirigiéndose al suroeste debajo de la primera palmera, luego gire a la derecha cruzando el segundo árbol
después de eso, gire bruscamente a la izquierda antes del tercer árbol y continúe hacia el sur. ¿entiendo?
do I go around the second tree or do I cross it?
nah, nada de rodear
solo crúzalo y luego sigue recto hacia el sur
I am going south of the second palm tree towards the dog. Where do I go now?
¡dulce! ahora desvíate un poco a la izquierda del cachorro, luego dirígete hacia el sur con un pequeño giro a la derecha
¿Cómo suena eso?
So I go around the dog and towards the southeast avoiding the rocks?
¡ojo! no, nada de evitar las rocas
pasarás entre una roca grande a tu izquierda y una pequeña a tu derecha. te llevarán directamente hasta el agua
so I pass diagonally between the rocks?
¡eso es! irás en línea recta entre las rocas hasta alcanzar el agua
Good. I am at the shoreline now. Where do I go?
¡serás el próximo moana! entra al agua y estarás frente a un gran cangrejo rojo
gira a la derecha, hacia el oeste, y sigue bordeando la gran roca. ¿lo tienes?
I might have passed between the wrong rocks. I went through the crevice on the west side instead of on the east side. Should I go through the water and turn towards the east towards the crab?
¡oh! oye, no te preocupes. necesito que te dirijas hacia el oeste, no hacia el este
vas a seguir la gran roca en el agua. ¿lo tienes ahora?
the one beneath the surfboard?
sí, esa misma. pero mantén tu nariz fuera del agua, ya que te llevará a una roca mediana en el mar
luego, te encontrarás con un tiburón y necesitarás girar con fuerza a la derecha. ¿listo para enfrentar al tiburón bravucon?
Yes. I went around the shark
¡bien hecho! ahora desde la roca mediana, dirígete hacia el norte, de vuelta a la tierra

general_survey.answer: Where I live in California there is an affluent population of Spanish speakers. I often communicate in Spanish at school and at work, and sometimes with my neighbors and parishioners.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
Do you speak any additional languages? If so, please describe briefly here.
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both English and Spanish?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
When you hear others mixing languages in conversation, how do you feel about it?
How natural was your conversational partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: My partner seemed to want to speak in the opposite language that I was speaking every time.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: I started studying "by the book" when I was 10, but I only really achieved an acceptable fluency a couple of years ago when I moved to a more Hispanic city in California and started taking Spanish immersion more seriously.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
